nodes.title: Having something to look forward to can boost your mood and lower your stress, studies suggest. Whether it's something small or large, like trying a new book or planning a trip, here are ways to incorporate the power of anticipation into everyday life. https://t.co/53fSJN7WaT
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Doctors successfully transplanted a 3-D printed ear made of living human cells. The new ear, transplanted in March, will continue to regenerate cartilage tissue, giving it the look and feel of a natural ear, said the biotech company that made the implant. https://t.co/gCmmBnOsKF https://t.co/DZbke2sNUN
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The U.S. will send Ukraine advanced rocket systems and munitions as part of a new $700 million package of military aid intended to help Ukrainians fight back against Russia, President Biden said on Tuesday. https://t.co/Sjvc44IRsp
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The gunman who killed four people at a Tulsa medical building underwent back surgery last month and the doctor who performed it was one of the victims, police said. His weapons included an AR-15-style rifle he bought hours before the attack. https://t.co/lddrAIQxdj

nodes.title: A woman who approached a bison at Yellowstone National Park was gored by the animal on Monday, according to park officials. Her condition was not released, and it was unclear whether she had survived. https://t.co/bHlV2l41zW
